message:
Confusion in the Central Camps area

Aljazeera channel reporter in the center of the Gaza Strip: We don't know what's going on.

There is mass hysteria in all the central camps. There are reports of many wounded and dead in the center of the strip, but there are no official numbers as of this moment.

The Palestinian Ministry of Health reports difficulties in receiving casualties at Deir al-Balah's largest medical center, "al-Aqsa's Martyrs" Hospital.

message:
IDF Activity in the Gaza Strip

The IDF spokesman recently reported on the IDF's activities in various areas of the Gaza Strip:

1. Security around the American floating pier will be increased following its reconstruction, and in preparation for the re-entry of goods through it.

2. Brigade 401 raided a military compound belonging to Hamas' Tal a-Sultan battalion in western Rafah (south of the Gaza Strip). Tunnel shafts and weapons were located.

3. Division 98 is engaged in combat in the center of the Gaza Strip, specifically in the eastern sector of Deir al-Balah and eastern al-Bureij, operating near one of the tunnel shafts were rockets that were ready to be launched exploded.

In the Deir al-Balah sector, Palestinians reported this morning a new advance of Israeli armored vehicles in the Abu al-Ajeen area in the southeast of Deir al-Balah (located in the western part of central Gaza).

It's worth noting that the IDF forces have not yet conducted an in-depth maneuver in the Deir al-Balah and Nuseirat areas in central Gaza, which - after Rafah - remain the last ground targets in the Gaza Strip that the forces need to address.
event_breakdown: IDF forces in the Tal a-Sultan battalion area in western Rafah (south of the Gaza Strip) were engaging with members of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad. Firing of ammunition was heard in the area.

message: The street in Nuseirat where the Israeli special forces passed through as part of the rescue operation, according to Palestinian sources.
event_breakdown: Israeli special forces passed through Nuseirat as part of a rescue operation to rescue Israeli teenagers who went missing in the West Bank, according to Palestinian sources. The Israeli teenagers went missing on Thursday night, and it is not yet clear who was behind the abduction. The Israeli army launched a search for the missing teenagers on Thursday night, and Israeli forces conducted a raid on Nuseirat, which is located in the central West Bank, on Saturday night. There were no immediate reports of injuries in the operation. The Israeli army later announced that the missing teenagers had been found safe and that they were being taken to an Israeli hospital for medical treatment.

message:
A joint statement by the IDF spokesperson, the Shin Bet, and the Israeli police:

In a complex operation by the IDF, the Shin Bet, and the Israel Police (YMM), four Israeli hostages were rescued this morning (Saturday). The hostages are Noa Argamani (25), Almog Meir (21), Andrey Kozlov (27), and Shlomi Ziv (40), who were kidnapped by Hamas and taken to the Gaza Strip from the 'Nova Festival' party on October 7. The abductees were rescued by Shin Bet and IDF fighters from two different locations during the operation in the heart of Nuseirat.

They are in stable medical condition, and they have been transferred for further medical examinations at the Tel Hashomer Sheba Medical Center.

Israel will continue to make every effort to bring back the hostages.
event_breakdown: IDF, Shin Bet, and Israel Police rescued four Israeli hostages in the Gaza Strip.

message:
Hamas is trying to counter public opinion following the revelation by the IDF spokesman that 17 terrorists were killed in the attack on the UNRWA school in Nuseirat.

After the IDF spokesman published 👆 a new list last night of 8 terrorists who were killed in the attack on the school in Nuseirat, an event that received significant international attention, Hamas moved to a defensive position.

Late last night, the Hamas information office held a press conference, claiming that 3 of the dead mentioned by the IDF were still alive and that 3-4 others were killed in different circumstances (not at the school). Hamas also published a list of 12 children it claims were killed in the attack.

What are the following conclusions?
1. When Israel does PR right, Hamas goes on the defensive. This is a positive development.
2. Instead of talking about the "massacre," Hamas focuses on the details of the "massacre." In such a situation, the intensity of criticism of Israel is reduced. "The issue is under investigation" and not clear and absolute.
3. When Israel counters Hamas's propaganda instead of observing from the sidelines, the situation improves slightly.

And now to the main question that Israel should present to Hamas as part of the debate on the "Massacre":
Hamas claimed that 40 people were killed, and published a detailed lists of the names of 12 children. Hamas pretends to have extensive knowledge of the names of the casualties and the circumstances of their death. Why don't they publish the complete list of all 40 dead? Why hide? What about the other 10-11 militants? Why were they hiding in the school? Let's discuss all the names.

Which brings me to my next point, why doesn't Hamas publish the names of its military operatives who were killed in airstrikes? 

One would think that the terrorist organization would pride itself in its "martyrs" - honor their dead, and publish the names of those killed in battle.  It appears that Hamas is more concerned about its public image. By not publishing these names, it maintains ambiguity with which it can accuse Israel of targeting civilians in schools / shelters / hospitals. 

Even Hezbollah does not behave this way. Hamas dishonors their dead just so it can lie and accuse Israel of war crimes. Pathetic.
event_breakdown: IDF spokesman reveals 17 terrorists were killed during the attack on the UNRWA school in Nuseirat. Hamas Counters Statements with Updated Casualty Statement.
